{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory / Logistics Officer",
  "description": "PG Consulting Limited is a recruitment, training and business consulting firm. We provide our clients - businesses and corporate organizations - across different industries with superior human capital, high-quality trainings and cutting-edge consulting to help them drive organizational growth, multiply staff productivity, gain appropriate market positioning and maximise profit.

Over the course of almost 20 years of our existence, we have serviced various organizations, many of which are strong indigenous brands operating with global standards. We are most inclined to building strong brands and supporting business growth across industries. Our preference is to work with our clients as partners on an on-going basis towards making their organizations internally effective and more profitable.&nbsp;As we grow into the future, the sustaining core of our operations is working with you, all the way, from People to Profit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory / Logistics Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Responsibilities


	Manage the inbound and outbound of additive inventory of materials and product in warehouse.
	Coordinate the receiving of additive stocks from shipment with laid-down company&#39;s SOP regulations
	Develops efficiency plans to improve quality &amp; time management in supplies of additive product to customers with quality timing.
	Ensure daily, weekly and monthly reports of Additive inbound and outbound&#39;with batches and shelf life of product.
	Ensure samples of every batch of additive documented with accuracy
	Ensure degree of accuracy of additive orders from placement of additive orders to making delivery of stocks to customers.
	Responsible for the management, maintenance, and safety of additive stocks in warehouse.
	Ensure that additive product is handled with utmost care and safety measures are properly followed with SOP laid down regulations.
	Ensure product integrity with less damages of drums
	Ensure implementation of Standard of operations processes and process efficiency.
	Supervise the loaders in charge of additives and forklift operator follows loading and transfer, and storage plans in each location in line with Pacegate guidelines.
	Coordinate the entire loading and offloading of additives.
	Ensure the warehouse is always clean and properly arranged.
	Receive and record all stock transaction in ERP .
	Organize the Warehouse by arranging products using FEFO (First Expiry First Out)
	Manage the all-forklift maintenance (servicing date, repairs etc) and report to the Line Manager.
	Maintain the office &amp; Office equipment to always be in good working condition
	Prepare and send goods cleared report every 2 weeks
	Flag all close expiry and product aging analysis.
	Report slow and obsolete stocks on monthly basis. &middot;
	Report all products with damages or non-conformity packages


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in inventory or logistics supervision, preferably in a Manufacturing setting.
	Professional certifications (e.g., CILT, APICS, or supply chain-related) are an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of warehouse management systems and inventory control methodologies.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Office tools.
	Familiarity with Nigerian logistics networks and regulatory requirements.
	Excellent planning, organizational, and analytical skills.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills.
	Ability to thrive under pressure and meet tight deadlines


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 Monthly (Net).

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;jobs@pgconsultingng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

Inventory / Logistics Officer Job at PG Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        PG Consulting Limited is a recruitment, training and business consulting firm. We provide our clients - businesses and corporate organizations - across different industries with superior human capital, high-quality trainings and cutting-edge consulting to help them drive organizational growth, multiply staff productivity, gain appropriate market positioning and maximise profit.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Over the course of almost 20 years of our existence, we have serviced various organizations, many of which are strong indigenous brands operating with global standards. We are most inclined to building strong brands and supporting business growth across industries. Our preference is to work with our clients as partners on an on-going basis towards making their organizations internally effective and more profitable. As we grow into the future, the sustaining core of our operations is working with you, all the way, from People to Profit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory / Logistics Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Responsibilities


	Manage the inbound and outbound of additive inventory of materials and product in warehouse.
	Coordinate the receiving of additive stocks from shipment with laid-down company's SOP regulations
	Develops efficiency plans to improve quality & time management in supplies of additive product to customers with quality timing.
	Ensure daily, weekly and monthly reports of Additive inbound and outbound'with batches and shelf life of product.
	Ensure samples of every batch of additive documented with accuracy
	Ensure degree of accuracy of additive orders from placement of additive orders to making delivery of stocks to customers.
	Responsible for the management, maintenance, and safety of additive stocks in warehouse.
	Ensure that additive product is handled with utmost care and safety measures are properly followed with SOP laid down regulations.
	Ensure product integrity with less damages of drums
	Ensure implementation of Standard of operations processes and process efficiency.
	Supervise the loaders in charge of additives and forklift operator follows loading and transfer, and storage plans in each location in line with Pacegate guidelines.
	Coordinate the entire loading and offloading of additives.
	Ensure the warehouse is always clean and properly arranged.
	Receive and record all stock transaction in ERP .
	Organize the Warehouse by arranging products using FEFO (First Expiry First Out)
	Manage the all-forklift maintenance (servicing date, repairs etc) and report to the Line Manager.
	Maintain the office & Office equipment to always be in good working condition
	Prepare and send goods cleared report every 2 weeks
	Flag all close expiry and product aging analysis.
	Report slow and obsolete stocks on monthly basis. ·
	Report all products with damages or non-conformity packages


Qualifications & Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in inventory or logistics supervision, preferably in a Manufacturing setting.
	Professional certifications (e.g., CILT, APICS, or supply chain-related) are an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of warehouse management systems and inventory control methodologies.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Office tools.
	Familiarity with Nigerian logistics networks and regulatory requirements.
	Excellent planning, organizational, and analytical skills.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills.
	Ability to thrive under pressure and meet tight deadlines


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 Monthly (Net).

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: jobs@pgconsultingng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Jiji.ng
content:
Jiji.ng is the largest online marketplace in Nigeria which connects Real Buyers with Sellers. Jiji was launched in 2014 and currently serves over 200 Million users in 5 different countries.

Jiji is the best place to sell anything to real people. It is the biggest free online classified with an advanced security system. We provide a simple, hassle-free solution to sell and buy almost anything. We boast of a work environment that promotes and supports career progress. This is evident with our growing presence across 5 countries and counting.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Merchant Acquisition Associate
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking to hire Merchant Acquisition Associates who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing & Business Development.


Scope of work:
As a Merchant Acquisition Associate, you will be required to:


	Identify new businesses interested in marketing and advertising products & services on Jiji and register them on the platform
	Enlighten business owners on the benefits of Jiji’s Premium Services
	Sell Jiji’s Subscription Packages to business owners
	Use CRM tool to update and upload relevant sales information
	Applicants should be between the ages of 18 and 40 years.


Benefits
Join our team to enjoy benefits such as:


	World-class on-the-job experience & training certificate.
	Fantastic career growth trajectory.
	Earn up to ?200,000 monthly.
	Learn new skills and gain hands-on job experience.
	Get 17% of the total sales you make as commissions.
	Get up to ?34,000 in extra allowances.
	HMO plan upon confirmation.
	Team bonding activities and events.


Application Closing Date; 24th December, 2025. 

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Sales Associate

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are looking to hire Sales Associates who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing & Business Development.


Scope of work
As a Sales Associate, you will be required to:


	Identify new businesses interested in marketing and advertising products & services on Jiji and register them on the platform
	Enlighten business owners on the benefits of Jiji’s Premium Services
	Sell Jiji’s Subscription Packages to business owners
	Use CRM tool to update and upload relevant sales information.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications
	Applicants should be between the ages of 18 and 40 years.


Join our team to enjoy benefits such as


	World-class on-the-job experience & training certificate.
	Fantastic career growth trajectory.
	Earn up to N200,000 monthly.
	Learn new skills and gain hands-on job experience.
	Get 17% of the total sales you make as commissions.
	Get up to ?34,000 in extra allowances.
	HMO plan upon confirmation.
	Team bonding activities and events.


Application Closing Date: 26th December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Vendor Acquisition Agent

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are hiring Vendor Acquisition Agents who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing, & Business Development.


Your Task


	Communicate and sell Jiji to sellers
	Register clients/sellers on our platform.


Requirements


	Must be resident in Kano
	Willingness to learn
	Minimum of SSCE
	18 - 45 years of age.


Benefits


	Earn up to N200,000 monthly
	Get paid for every seller you register
	Earn commissions of up to30% on sales.


Application Closing Date: 3rd December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Matrix Homes and Properties Limited is a reputable Real Estate Company based in Lagos, Nigeria. As a real estate developer and investment company, Matrix Homes offers services such as property development, sales, and investment. We focus on making home acquisition affordable to all Nigerians while maintaining high standards of quality and integrity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Business Development Manager will be responsible for driving sales growth, building strategic partnerships, and expanding the company&rsquo;s market presence.
	This role requires a dynamic professional with strong negotiation skills, deep knowledge of the Nigerian real estate market, and the ability to deliver results in a competitive environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities in property sales, leasing, and investment.
	Develop and implement strategies to achieve revenue and growth targets.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, investors, and corporate partners.
	Conduct market research to track industry trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Collaborate with marketing teams to design and execute promotional campaigns.
	Represent the company at industry events, exhibitions, and networking forums.
	Prepare and deliver business proposals, presentations, and reports to management.
	Mentor and support junior sales staff to enhance team performance.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	HND/ Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in business development, sales, or marketing within the real estate sector.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
	Knowledge of Nigerian property laws, investment climate, and urban development trends.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Candidates must reside within Egbeda and its environs.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;hr@matrixhomesproperties.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-13",

  },

Business Development Manager Job at Matrix Homes and Properties Limited




        
    

        
        Matrix Homes and Properties Limited is a reputable Real Estate Company based in Lagos, Nigeria. As a real estate developer and investment company, Matrix Homes offers services such as property development, sales, and investment. We focus on making home acquisition affordable to all Nigerians while maintaining high standards of quality and integrity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Business Development Manager will be responsible for driving sales growth, building strategic partnerships, and expanding the company’s market presence.
	This role requires a dynamic professional with strong negotiation skills, deep knowledge of the Nigerian real estate market, and the ability to deliver results in a competitive environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities in property sales, leasing, and investment.
	Develop and implement strategies to achieve revenue and growth targets.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, investors, and corporate partners.
	Conduct market research to track industry trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Collaborate with marketing teams to design and execute promotional campaigns.
	Represent the company at industry events, exhibitions, and networking forums.
	Prepare and deliver business proposals, presentations, and reports to management.
	Mentor and support junior sales staff to enhance team performance.


Qualifications & Skills


	HND/ Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in business development, sales, or marketing within the real estate sector.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
	Knowledge of Nigerian property laws, investment climate, and urban development trends.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Candidates must reside within Egbeda and its environs.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: hr@matrixhomesproperties.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

  "title": "Executive Administrative Secretary",
  "description": "Multinet Group Ltd is a leading investment holding and service provider company based in Abuja, Nigeria, offering diverse solutions across multiple sectors. Our expertise includes oil and gas, Engineering Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning (EPCIC); General contracting; Security and Surveillance; real Technical Consulting. With a commitment to sustainable growth and innovation, we provide exceptional and pioneering business solutions and sustainable services to clients in both the public and private sectors, ensuring our relevance in an ever-changing global market.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Administrative Secretary
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Manage executive schedules, appointments, travel plans, and meeting logistics.
	Prepare and format correspondence, reports, and presentations.
	Maintain confidential records, databases, and filing systems.
	Take minutes during executive meetings and follow up on action items.
	Coordinate communication between management, staff, and external stakeholders.
	Organize and support company events, conferences, and stakeholder engagements.
	Monitor incoming calls, emails, and inquiries; prioritize and redirect as appropriate.
	Ensure the office always operates efficiently and professionally.
	Ensure confidentiality in all matters concerning the executive and the company
	Handle sensitive information with discretion.


Requirements


	The candidate must have the ability to develop proposals, letters of correspondence and other related documentation without supervision.
	The candidate must be computer literate with proficiency in Microsoft office including word, Excel, Powerpoint and outlook.
	The right candidate will join an ambitious team with great vision and creative energy and must have ability and capacity to work within a team.
	The successful candidate must also have capacity and confidence to work, communicate effectively
	Strong analytical and multitasking skills and experience in performing rigorous analysis in support of highly visible work.
	Excellent written and oral communication skills sufficient to communicate complex subject matter effectively.
	Proven ability to work both independently and as a member of a team in a fast-paced dynamic and creative environment requiring ability to juggle tasks to meet deadlines with rapidly changing priorities.
	Ability to work with colleagues and partners of varied backgrounds and experience.


Salary
N150,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;multinetrecurit@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Executive Administrative Secretary Job at Multinet Group Ltd




        
    

        
        Multinet Group Ltd is a leading investment holding and service provider company based in Abuja, Nigeria, offering diverse solutions across multiple sectors. Our expertise includes oil and gas, Engineering Procurement, Construction, Installation and Commissioning (EPCIC); General contracting; Security and Surveillance; real Technical Consulting. With a commitment to sustainable growth and innovation, we provide exceptional and pioneering business solutions and sustainable services to clients in both the public and private sectors, ensuring our relevance in an ever-changing global market. 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Administrative Secretary
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Manage executive schedules, appointments, travel plans, and meeting logistics.
	Prepare and format correspondence, reports, and presentations.
	Maintain confidential records, databases, and filing systems.
	Take minutes during executive meetings and follow up on action items.
	Coordinate communication between management, staff, and external stakeholders.
	Organize and support company events, conferences, and stakeholder engagements.
	Monitor incoming calls, emails, and inquiries; prioritize and redirect as appropriate.
	Ensure the office always operates efficiently and professionally.
	Ensure confidentiality in all matters concerning the executive and the company
	Handle sensitive information with discretion.


Requirements


	The candidate must have the ability to develop proposals, letters of correspondence and other related documentation without supervision.
	The candidate must be computer literate with proficiency in Microsoft office including word, Excel, Powerpoint and outlook.
	The right candidate will join an ambitious team with great vision and creative energy and must have ability and capacity to work within a team.
	The successful candidate must also have capacity and confidence to work, communicate effectively
	Strong analytical and multitasking skills and experience in performing rigorous analysis in support of highly visible work.
	Excellent written and oral communication skills sufficient to communicate complex subject matter effectively.
	Proven ability to work both independently and as a member of a team in a fast-paced dynamic and creative environment requiring ability to juggle tasks to meet deadlines with rapidly changing priorities.
	Ability to work with colleagues and partners of varied backgrounds and experience.


Salary
N150,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: multinetrecurit@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply
